title: Trump sought foreign interference in 2020: whistleblower
text:
In a high-stakes hearing, Acting Director of National Intelligence, Joseph Maguire, testified Thursday before Congress about a whistleblower complaint against U.S. President Donald Trump, and defended the administration’s decision to withhold that complaint from Congress.

(SOUNDBITE) (English) ACTING DIRECTOR OF NATIONAL INTELLIGENCE JOSEPH MAGUIRE SAYING:

“Until executive privilege is determined and cleared, I did not have the authority to be able to send that forward to the committee. It is the White House that determines that, I cannot determine that as director of national intelligence.”

(SOUNDBITE) (English) HOUSE INTELLIGENCE CHIEF ADAM SCHIFF, SAYING:

“But in this case, The White House, the president is the subject of the complaint, he's the subject of the wrongdoing.”

(SOUNDBITE) (English) ACTING DIRECTOR OF NATIONAL INTELLIGENCE JOSEPH MAGUIRE SAYING:

“Mr. Chairman, as I said in my opening statement, I believe that everything here is unprecedented.”

The complaint, which was released publicly Thursday, said President Trump used his office to solicit Ukraine's interference in the 2020 election to advance his personal political interests, risking U.S. national security.

The complaint details the July 25th call, the notes from which were released Wednesday, which showed Trump asking Ukrainian president Volodymyr Zelenskiy investigate Joe Biden and his son Hunter.

According to the complaint: the whistleblower was contacted by multiple White House officials who said they were deeply disturbed by the president’s conduct on the call and also by the White House’s efforts to allegedly "lock down” all records of call.

The complaint claimed officials were allegedly directed by White House lawyers to move the transcript of the call to a separate electronic system reserved for classified matters.

The complaint and the effort to withhold the complaint from Congress has prompted Democrats to launch an official impeachment inquiry.

Trump denies doing anything wrong and claims the whistleblower was “partisan.”

Maguire stressed that the whistleblower was acting in good faith.

(SOUNDBITE) (English) ACTING DIRECTOR OF NATIONAL INTELLIGENCE JOSEPH MAGUIRE SAYING:

"I have every reason to believe that they have done everything by the book and followed the law.”

(SOUNDBITE) (English) HOUSE INTELLIGENCE CHIEF ADAM SCHIFF, SAYING:

“Can we at least agree that the inspector general made a sound conclusion that this whistleblower complaint was credible?”

(SOUNDBITE) (English) ACTING DIRECTOR OF NATIONAL INTELLIGENCE JOSEPH MAGUIRE SAYING:

“That is correct.”

The complainee said they heard from multiple officials that were concerned by what they viewed as Trump’s personal attorney Rudy Giuliani’s “circumvention of national security decision making process” to relay messages between Kiev and trump.

(SOUNDBITE) (English) U.S. REPRESENTATIVE MIKE QUIGLEY, SAYING:

"What is your understanding right now of what Mr. Giuliani’s role is?”

(SOUNDBITE) (English) ACTING DIRECTOR OF NATIONAL INTELLIGENCE JOSEPH MAGUIRE SAYING:

“I lead, and I support the intelligence community and the 17 different departments and agencies underneath my leadership. I do not lead the president and I have no authority or responsibility over the White House.”

On Capital Hill – Democrats tried to get Maguire to confirm to opine on what was in the complaint.

(SOUNDBITE) (English) ACTING DIRECTOR OF NATIONAL INTELLIGENCE JOSEPH MAGUIRE SAYING:

“Right now all we have is an allegation of second information from a whistleblower. I have no knowledge on whether or not that is true and accurate statement.”

But he did say he takes election interference seriously.

(SOUNDBITE) (English) ACTING DIRECTOR OF NATIONAL INTELLIGENCE JOSEPH MAGUIRE SAYING:

“I think the greatest challenge that we do have is to make sure we make sure to maintain the integrity of our election system. We know right now that there are foreign powers who are trying to get us to question the validity on whether or not our elections are valid.”

Trump tweeted that, "THE DEMOCRATS ARE TRYING TO DESTROY THE REPUBLICAN PARTY AND ALL THAT IT STANDS FOR, STICK TOGETHER, PLAY THEIR GAME, AND FIGHT HARD REPUBLICANS. OUR COUNTRY IS AT STAKE!"

In a high-stakes hearing, Acting Director of National Intelligence, Joseph Maguire, testified Thursday before Congress about a whistleblower complaint against U.S. President Donald Trump, and defended the administration’s decision to withhold that complaint from Congress. 
              (SOUNDBITE) (English) ACTING DIRECTOR OF NATIONAL INTELLIGENCE JOSEPH MAGUIRE SAYING: 
              “Until executive privilege is determined and cleared, I did not have the authority to be able to send that forward to the committee. It is the White House that determines that, I cannot determine that as director of national intelligence.” 
              (SOUNDBITE) (English) HOUSE INTELLIGENCE CHIEF ADAM SCHIFF, SAYING: 
              “But in this case, The White House, the president is the subject of the complaint, he's the subject of the wrongdoing.” 
              (SOUNDBITE) (English) ACTING DIRECTOR OF NATIONAL INTELLIGENCE JOSEPH MAGUIRE SAYING: 
              “Mr. Chairman, as I said in my opening statement, I believe that everything here is unprecedented.” 
              The complaint, which was released publicly Thursday, said President Trump used his office to solicit Ukraine's interference in the 2020 election to advance his personal political interests, risking U.S. national security. 
              The complaint details the July 25th call, the notes from which were released Wednesday, which showed Trump asking Ukrainian president Volodymyr Zelenskiy investigate Joe Biden and his son Hunter. 
              According to the complaint: the whistleblower was contacted by multiple White House officials who said they were deeply disturbed by the president’s conduct on the call and also by the White House’s efforts to allegedly "lock down” all records of call.  
              The complaint claimed officials were allegedly directed by White House lawyers to move the transcript of the call to a separate electronic system reserved for classified matters. 
              The complaint and the effort to withhold the complaint from Congress has prompted Democrats to launch an official impeachment inquiry. 
              Trump denies doing anything wrong and claims the whistleblower was “partisan.” 
              Maguire stressed that the whistleblower was acting in good faith. 
              (SOUNDBITE) (English) ACTING DIRECTOR OF NATIONAL INTELLIGENCE JOSEPH MAGUIRE SAYING:

              “Right now all we have is an allegation of second information from a whistleblower. I have no knowledge on whether or not that is true and accurate statement.” 
              But he did say he takes election interference seriously. 
              (SOUNDBITE) (English) ACTING DIRECTOR OF NATIONAL INTELLIGENCE JOSEPH MAGUIRE SAYING: 
              “I think the greatest challenge that we do have is to make sure we make sure to maintain the integrity of our election system. We know right now that there are foreign powers who are trying to get us to question the validity on whether or not our elections are valid.” 
              Trump tweeted that, "THE DEMOCRATS ARE TRYING TO DESTROY THE REPUBLICAN PARTY AND ALL THAT IT STANDS FOR, STICK TOGETHER, PLAY THEIR GAME, AND FIGHT HARD REPUBLICANS. OUR COUNTRY IS AT STAKE!"
